message.content:
cs.NI, cs.CR, cs.SI, cs.DS, cs.AI 

This paper deals with the detection and characterization of DDoS attacks in ISP domains, which involves network infrastructure and security. Therefore, the most likely category is cs.NI (Networking and Internet Architecture). The paper also involves statistical analysis and anomaly detection, which could fall under cs.CR (Cryptography and Security) and cs.SI (Social and Information Networks). Additionally, the use of NS-2 network simulator suggests a possible category of cs.DS (Data Structures and Algorithms). Finally, the paper mentions the use of Six-Sigma and varying tolerance factor methods, which could be related to cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence).
